title: Bigg Boss 16 11th February Day 132 Highlights
article_content: Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! At this point, I would say that the Grand Finale of Bigg Boss 16 is already here and the contestants were in for a treat filled full of twists and turns, with the contestants giving it their all in the face of danger as Rohit Shetty himself comes in the house to select the first contestant of his reality show, ‚ÄúKhatron Ke Khiladi‚Äù. But as we know that the fights never stop, Priyanka Chahar Choudhary , went head to head with Shalin Bhanot , with the two of them exchanging heated words. Priyanka accused Shalin of using other female contestants like Tina Datta and Soundarya Sharma to advance in the show, while Shalin countered that Priyanka only wanted ‚Äúfootage‚Äù and created the fight for that reason! But, I didn‚Äôt mind this fight considering it might be the last fight of the season. Enter the master of stunts himself, Rohit Shetty, who announced that he had come to select the finalist for ‚ÄúKhatron Ke Khiladi 13‚Äù. The contestants took turns naming the toughest competitor, with Archana Gautam being picked for her innocent charm by MC Stan , Priyanka naming Shiv Thakare for his strength and vice versa. Archana chooses Shiv, while Shalin selected Priyanka. The first stunt was the ‚ÄúFear of the Unknown‚Äù, with contestants facing black boxes containing unknown objects. Archana started and was scared when she pulled out a vegetable, but in the next box, she felt a bite and backed off. MC Stan also felt a sting, but he gave up. The prankster? A volunteer with a cucumber! A post shared by ColorsTV (@colorstv) The real stunt was an underwater challenge, where contestants had to unlock screws and reach the finish line. MC Stan breezed through the first lock but ran out of breath. Archana struggled but successfully unlocked herself. Shiv triumphed, while Shalin went shirtless and completed the task effortlessly, leaving everyone in awe. Priyanka, however, struggled and gave up. It was time for some fun after the intense task, and Rohit assigned MC Stan to be Archana‚Äôs father and Shalin as the suitor. Impersonating his funny voice, he dished out hilarious one-liners and even jokingly roasted Shalin‚Äôs love for chicken. Bringing in his rap skills, he skewered both with his ‚ÄúToqueer Sahab‚Äù voice, leaving everyone in stitches. MC Stan‚Äôs new avatar is loveable than ever. A post shared by ColorsTV (@colorstv) The game took a hilarious turn with a twist on dum charades, where every wrong guess resulted in a shock from the bands on their hands. Shalin and Priyanka started, and after some shocks, finally guessed Archana‚Äôs famous phrase. Archana and Shiv went next, and Archana‚Äôs epic reactions to ‚Äúcaptaincy‚Äù were a sight to behold. In the next round, Archana and Shiv navigated through lasers while blindfolded, with Archana facing plenty of shocks, but with Shiv‚Äôs hilarious guidance, they made it to the end. Priyanka and Shalin followed, overcoming shocks and completing the task, emerging as the winners. The final challenge was a race to victory, riding a cycle and collecting cards, all to break a towering glass with a single blow. Priyanka took off with ease, her nimble fingers quickly grabbing the cards. Shalin followed with a flourish, his performance so smooth that everyone was left in awe. But when Shalin was called to the house, he refused, revealing that he had a fear that kept him from continuing the show. Archana protested, saying it wasn‚Äôt fair to Shiv who lost his chance because of Shalin. But, I must say that Shalin played very well and certainly deserves to be in ‚ÄúKKK13‚Äù. The contestants gave it their all, and it was a nail-biting finish that left everyone on the edge of their seats. The making of grand finale was also shown which made me all excited and has now left me eagerly waiting for d-day. Get ready for more updates and gossip, and don‚Äôt forget to grab your popcorn!

title: Bigg Boss 16 Grand Finale Winner Announced: Rapper MC Stan Takes the Title

After a journey of more than four months in the Bigg Boss 16 house, curtains have been dropped and Salman Khan has finally declared the most-awaited winner of the season and its none other than Bigg Boss 16‚Äôs ‚ÄúBasti Ka Hasti‚Äù MC Stan . The first runner-up is Marathi Bigg Boss winner Shiv Thakare followed by the second runner up who is the highly opinionated Priyanka Chahar Choudhary and honestly, it actually left me shocked when she got out of the race. She added, While my mom and her sister and all the women I have grown up with over the years have always been a big inspiration to my life, my current most important inspirational woman in my life is Anupamaa! Rupali Ganguly from the sets of Anupamaa A post shared by Rups (@rupaliganguly) She also said that she is grateful for all the values Anupamaa has inculcated in her, and continues to do so, every working day. title: Palki Malhotra Exclusive Interview with MissMalini
article_content: Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! With a remarkable contribution in the world of Television series, Palki Malhotra has seen phenomenal success with shows like ‚Äò Dill Mill Gayye ‚Äò, ‚ÄòDil Dostii Dance‚Äô under her name. The creative producer, writer, producer and dance director is now creating waves with her latest show, ‚ÄòCampus Beats‚Äô starring Shantanu Maheshwari , Shruti Sinha, Sahaj Singh Chahal, and Tanvi Gadkari. In a candid chat with MissMalini, Palki talks about the her latest show, the evolvement in the OTT space and more. ‚ÄòCampus Beats‚Äô is your second dance show after ‚ÄòDil Dostii Dance‚Äô, why and how do you feel this genre connects with the youth? ‚ÄòCampus Beats‚Äô is just not the dance show, both the shows have a campus, the rivalry, the connection, the growing up, the coming of age, and living, exploring, and understanding our own life and others. The years when you are actually finding yourself and the external world around you are what you remember the most and you cherish the most. If somebody asks you about your growth, you will always go back to your school days because at that point in time, passion is a key you give so much importance to. So growing up is the most relatable aspect of anybody‚Äôs life. And, that is why ‚ÄòDil Dosti Dance‚Äô has worked and I feel ‚ÄòCampus Beats‚Äô will also resonate with the audience because it‚Äôs not just the genre but also about exploring ourselves. It‚Äôs about understanding the world and what you are capable of in the world around you. And then of course there‚Äôs a tadka of dance. Youth shows like these will forever connect with the youth. It‚Äôs just that you need to understand the show and you need to make it with that purity. Tell us about the idea behind the concept of ‚ÄòCampus Beats‚Äô? The idea behind ‚ÄòCampus Beats‚Äô was that I wanted to make a youth show for the longest time. In 2013, ‚ÄòDil Dosti Dance‚Äô and I parted ways and from then I always had the idea of creating another youth show. But it just took a very long time, the industry was going through a lot of changes, youth channels shut down, and OTT began to bloom. But, the one thing that remained constant was the hunger for youth shows. And when I noticed, that there were not many youth shows offered to the youth of India. The youth started to tilt towards K-Dramas. For me, K-Dramas was something that I thought was exactly what we used to do during our ‚ÄòStar One‚Äô or ‚ÄòChannel V‚Äô days because ‚ÄòDill Mil Gayye‚Äô or ‚ÄòD3‚Äô were pretty much similar to K-Dramas. So that‚Äôs when I was aggressively pitching to get back the youth shows, writing them again, and pitching it with the tadka of a thriller. So I thought, why not do a Campus series that can have a thriller aspect with a teen drama. I really thought it was required and the youth of India was really looking for it, which is a pretty clean, fun, relatable, light-hearted drama and that is the reason we came up with ‚ÄòCampus Beats‚Äô. In the near future, what is the kind of content you are looking at creating in the OTT space? OTT is a very interesting space, you get to do a lot of things. But having said that, there is a particular pattern that OTT sees like for example, if it‚Äôs crime, if there is a show which is popular in crime, then there will be a lot of people making a lot of crime shows. So I personally do not want to follow that pattern. I would want to do something very different and offer something very different on board. I like to break patterns. I am that kind of a person. The other thing is that I personally feel that OTT in India, whatever content we are offering is not very tilted towards youth. So I feel, it is required that India needs to make good youth content, homegrown content, not just you know replicate something or remake something. I feel that the youth of India is tilting towards the western side or not just Western I mean, tilting towards international shows, fiction shows, but it is so cool if we can create our own and we can get that madness for our homegrown products. We used to make great shows. We had fantastic shows where the whole youth of India was crazier I mean, they were crazy about so many shows earlier during the good old days of ‚ÄòStar One‚Äô and ‚ÄòChannel V‚Äô and ‚ÄòMTV‚Äô for that matter. As a content creator and producer, would you say the OTT space is a boon for you? OTT has been a boon to almost everybody in the industry, so what it offers is a bridge between TV and films or I would say it offers a middle ground to people. There were a lot of people who were getting frustrated with it, with the kind of work that was happening on TV. They were also getting frustrated because they were probably not getting work in films. So what OTT has done for everybody is offered a mid path. It‚Äôs a fantastic way of bringing a different kind of vision on board.What has also happened is that suddenly you know India has come together to watch other content. With the digital boom, the shows OTT have been releasing in plenty, how important is it for you to ensure that your show stands out and stays with the audience? For any creator it is important for their show to stand out, right? It is extremely important. All I can say is that the moment you stop following a pattern you will stand out. So one of the reasons why we are a ‚ÄòCampus Beats‚Äô, a teen drama amidst so much mystery and thriller that has been launched or is being launched right now, I feel that ‚ÄòCampus Beats‚Äô is going to stand out big time. I try my level best to always be different with the kind of stuff that I‚Äôm bringing about. I mean it needs to be different from the herd mentality that is going on right now. Even the marketing needs to be different. I mean that‚Äôs extremely important to any show. So if you‚Äôre talking about, pumping up, pumping numbers, the numbers will also come with the kind of marketing you‚Äôre doing. You also need to put a lot of soul into creating content, but also creating a very different kind of marketing for yourself. What‚Äôs in store for Palki? For me, it is something where I need to make a difference. I do not believe in making shows, I believe in creating legacies. So I try my level best with whatever show that I bring about, to create a legacy of its own that people talk about even after a decade. And I‚Äôm very proud of my previous shows like ‚ÄòDil Dostii Dance‚Äô and ‚ÄòDill Mill Gayye‚Äô where people still till date talk about it and there‚Äôs still demand for Season 2. So I believe that no matter what I do, it is going to be me writing, directing or producing anything that I do because I want to create a legacy.

title: Anupamaa Actor Rupali Ganguly Reveals Her First Paycheck Amount And Opens Up On Financial Struggles - MissMalini
article_content: Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Popular television actress Rupali Ganguly, best known for her role as Anupamaa in the hit show ‚ÄúAnupamaa,‚Äù recently shared a heartfelt account of her family‚Äôs financial struggles during her formative years. The daughter of renowned filmmaker Anil Ganguly and sister to Bollywood choreographer Vijay Ganguly, Rupali opened up about the challenging times her family faced due to her father‚Äôs films not performing well at the box office. In a candid interview with Mashable India, Rupali revealed the adverse impact of consecutive box office failures of her father‚Äôs films, particularly mentioning the film ‚ÄúDushman Devta‚Äù led by Dharmendra. title: Instagram Launches ‚Äò1 Minute Music‚Äô Pop-Ups To Reimagine The Concept Of Music Videos On Reels - MissMalini
article_content: Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Without music we can‚Äôt even go for a day, can you? Music has the power to make people tap their feet. Hence, last week on World Music Day , Instagram launched # 1MinMusic pop-ups to highlight how music videos can be reimagined with the help of Reels . Check out more deets about this new feature and its launch right below. ‚Äò 1 Min Music ‚Äò is Instagram ‚Äòs music property to inspire emerging and established artists to innovate and create music in a completely new way. This new feature will allow you to illustrate music videos creatively on Reels . The pop-ups of the same will be held in multiple cities which started with Gurgoan. The artists will be paired with Instagram -first videographers to shoot their music videos using multiple creative studio backdrops and genre-specific setups created especially for this pop-up. It‚Äôs a property featuring exclusive music tracks and videos from over 200 national and regional artists. As part of this property, music from Shaan, Mame Khan, Himanshi Khurana and Kaur B have already been released. A selected few artists created their own original music with music videos shot at the pop-up of the launch of 1 Min Music which were released immediately. The first pop-up in the series was launched by the cast of ‚Äò Jug Jugg Jeeyo ‚Äô, which included actors Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani, Anil Kapoor and Maniesh Paul . The actors unveiled a dialogue-based audio made for the promotion of the movie. And as you can see above, the audio, J-Mix was made by the super talented composer and meme creator, Mayur Jumani . The pop-up in Gurgaon was held from June 19th to 21st and featured artists such as Dhvani Bhanushali whose songs are already a sensation on Reels , Kabeer Kathpalia whose song ‚Äò Doobey ‚Äô got the nationwide grooving, Rashmeet Kaur whose version of ‚Äò Bajre Da Sitta ‚Äô has over 240k Reels created with it and Aditya A whose song ‚Äò Chaand Baaliyan ‚Äô has reached over hearts with a million of Reels created on it. This is what Aditya had to say about this new property Being discovered is hugely important for artists, so we get the motivation to hone our craft and start to get monetizable opportunities. On Reels, music is the currency that‚Äôs getting people to share their talent and experiences, and getting discovered in that process. That‚Äôs why #1MinMusic is a legit format because it‚Äôs highly consumed. I‚Äôm happy to be part of this property from Instagram and to also launch my original with a music video at the pop-up. The cast also collaborated with other creators, such as Komal Pandey, Siddharth Batra, RJ Abhinav, Saloni Gaur and Shubham Gaur. Check their profiles out to watch their Reels . The Director, ‚Äã‚Äã Content & Community Partnerships of Facebook India, Paras Sharma said‚Ä¶ With #1MinMusic Pop-ups, we plan to democratize song releases and music video creation, so artists everywhere can shoot and release their videos on Reels. This will lead to the faster discovery of new talent, and greater salience for music from established artists. We‚Äôre thankful to the diverse group of artists who‚Äôre part of the pop-up, and the cast of ‚ÄòJug Jugg Jeeyo‚Äô who kicked it off with their entertaining moves. All the songs that were released on the day of the launch are now available to use in the # 1MinMusic playlist, in the Reels audio library. So, follow the same immediately at the same time don‚Äôt forget to follow @missmalinitrending to get more information about your fave influencers, trends and creators. Stay safe!

title: World Social Media Day: 13 Creators Tell Us Which Career They‚Äôd Pick If Not Digital Creation - MissMalini
article_content: Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Social media plays a very important role in all our lives, right? But since social media has taken over our lives so much hence on the occasion of # WorldSocialMediaDay we wanted to know what would creators do if social media did not exist. Hence, we got a chance to ask a few creators about their alternative career options and their answers will literally blow your mind away. Really, we kid you not. Scroll down to know it all. A post shared by Ashi Khanna (@ashi_khanna) Maybe if not content creation or in front of the camera per se, I might have gone behind the camera and joined the production. Pretty good with arranging and managing stuff, while I could‚Äôve also learnt more about cameras and lighting since that intrigues my interest a lot. A post shared by Zaid Darbar (@zaid_darbar) If not a content creator then I would be an Interior designer or an actor. I have always loved designing spaces be it my studio Atrangz or my house. I always see things with a different perspective and make it look worth it and talking about acting I‚Äôve always had that actor in me and I love to pour out emotions through it. A post shared by Dhruv Shah (@shahdhruv1994) One way or another, I would definitely take a deep dive into the world of digital media. If content creation would not have happened, I can definitely see myself choosing digital marketing as an alternative career. Just the way I tell stories through my content, digital marketing too is all about telling a story that appeals to a target audience. If I wouldn‚Äôt have been making people laugh, I would be making them buy. A post shared by T A N Z E E L‚Ñ¢ (@tanzeel_khan03) The passion to create is something I‚Äôve always harboured, creation is not just about writing or singing, building is also creating. Had I not been creating content, if I wasn‚Äôt crooning a tune or penning a track, I may have explored engineering as a profession. A post shared by Shyam Sharma (@shyam_sharma) If not for content creation, you would still be seeing me in front of the camera, maybe the medium would have shifted from a portable screen to the silver screen. The acting bug has bitten me since time immemorial and I cannot imagine a career that does not involve performing. The journey would have been different, the medium would have been different but the dream would be the same, to entertain. A post shared by Karan Sonawane (@focusedindian) I am more than happy with the choices I have made in my life until now, but if I wouldn‚Äôt have been a content creator I would‚Äôve probably been in the entertainment industry, somewhere in the technical department like edit, light, direction or DOP, anything at all because growing up I was highly influenced and fascinated by the entertainment industry, still am. I loved and still love entertaining people and I wanted to do it in any way possible. I also dreamt of becoming a cricketer, though this plausible profession choice came about to me, quite late as I was descending into adulthood. This is when I thought to myself that the considerable amount of the time I had to do something about this as a prospective career has passed away, so I‚Äôll deal with whatever cards life has dealt me with which has led me to this! But I will always be open to anything the entertainment industry has to offer me. A post shared by Anmol Sachar (@anmolsachar) I always wanted to be a filmmaker. I love telling stories & entertaining people. If social media didn‚Äôt exist, I‚Äôd most likely be a filmmaker & for some reason, if that didn‚Äôt workout, I‚Äôd still be doing something creative like writing copy for ads or something on those lines. A post shared by Saurabh Ghadge (@saurabhghadge_vines) I‚Äôm really happy with the way life currently is. But if I wasn‚Äôt a content creator, I would definitely have been working in sports. I‚Äôve always wanted to be a cricketer as a child, but that, unfortunately, didn‚Äôt workout for me. So the most logical thing would be to opt for sports management due to my love and passion for cricket. I would be either studying sports management abroad or doing a 9 to 5 job in this field. A post shared by Ruhii Siingh (@ruhisingh12) If social media didn‚Äôt exist, it would have made no difference to my life as such. I am very happy and passionate about my acting and modelling career and I‚Äôm grateful to have worked in both fields with respectable names and to have actually learned a lot. Honestly, the only reason I am motivated to be on social media is because it gives me an opportunity to connect with my fans, and they‚Äôre all very sweet, so I‚Äôm really grateful for that. A post shared by Jake Sitlani (@jakesitlani) I would love to be a director just cause I would love to give a bunch of audiences my take and view on various social topics on a larger scale since our culture & society needs it. A post shared by D I K S H A (@diksharawat22) If I was not a content creator what would I be? This question gives me a little existential crisis but I‚Äôd probably have an organization/nonprofit, to help in raising money for animals around India. It‚Äôs something that is very important to me & I try to do a little in a small capacity. It‚Äôs not just an alternate career it‚Äôs something I‚Äôll eventually dive into. I want to have my own nonprofit, working for animals & animal rescuing. It‚Äôs a very consuming job & I don‚Äôt know if I have the heart to do it but we will know soon. A post shared by Tarini Shah | Content creator (@tarini_shah) Just before I started content creation I was a fan of math and statistics. I was working towards studying Actuarial Science so yes, I might have been an Actuary. My love for stats is really helping me out now with social media analytics. I guess some things just never change. A post shared by Aastha Shah (@aasthashah97) I would be a Financial Analyst or an Equity Research Analyst. I‚Äôve always loved playing around with numbers and researching about different companies to analyze them closely. Currently, I‚Äôm a CFA level 3 candidate so yes if not a content creator, I would definitely pursue something in finance. Well, all their alternative careers sound super interesting but we‚Äôre so glad all of them are into content creation ‚Äò cause they defo at some point in life have made us smile, laugh and relate to their content. title: Australian Chef Gary Mehigan Would Want To Cook And Dine With Amitabh Bachchan - MissMalini
article_content: Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Australian Chef, Gary Mehigan, who is known for his stint in Masterchef Australia, has made plenty of visits to India, however, this one is rather special. The celebrity chef has collaborated with Conosh for a three city culinary tour in India, where the selected theme for the Mumbai masterclass was ‚ÄòSummer Eggless Dessert‚Äô. In a candid chat with me, Gary Mehigan , dove into the details about what he is expecting out of this to tour, the evolution in the Indian food space and more! We know for a fact that your love for India keeps bringing you back to the country, what are you expecting from your visit this time? ‚ÄúWell, I have been here about 10 days now and have just had the most incredible experience filming in Leh Ladakh for the Hemis festival. I was so looking forward to it, and it exceeded all my expectations. And now, I am onto my work with Conosh, an experience dining and culinary learning platform, with a hands-on masterclass in Mumbai, and then we travel to Kolkata and do a hands-on masterclass and a curated dinner.‚Äù In the last few years, do you see an evolution in the culinary space or food industry in India? ‚ÄúAbsolutely, what Chefs like Thomas Zachariah, Pooja Dhingra, Prateek Sadhu, Varun Totlani and legends like Manish Mehrotra and Ranveer Brar are continuing to do by sharing and creating great food experiences, has really put India in the spotlight as a Culinary destination.‚Äù From your previous visits, can you share a culinary experience or moment that had an impact on you? ‚ÄúEvery time I come to India, I learn something new about your cuisine. I always take back at least one new recipe from Chefs or friends along the way. Also, meeting people who love food at events like the dinner pop-ups I do with Conosh is a very enriching experience.‚Äù Is there a wish list of things to do during your India visit this time? ‚ÄúWell, I have just ticked off a big one by filming in Leh Ladakh, which was just jaw-dropping. Way beyond my expectations. Next time I get a chance for some leisure here, I want to go back to Goa, see more of the Himalayas, and perhaps do a motorbike ride from Manali to Leh. It sounds quite challenging, and definitely on a Royal Enfield.‚Äù Do you remember the first time you tried out an Indian dish, which one was it and what was the experience like? ‚ÄúI have been cooking curries for years, but I had to cook a Dosa for a TV show, and it took me some time to perfect, but I had quite a few contacts from my visits to India on speed dial helping me.‚Äù If you could pick one Bollywood celebrity to cook for and dine with, who would it be and why? ‚ÄúAmitabh Bachchan. I think he would have some great stories to tell.‚Äù Well, being an epicurean, this meet and greet and chat sesh with Gary for me was definitely a wholesome experience and one where I have taken back learnings and memories to cherish. All I can say is that I cannot wait to meet this Masterchef soon and hopefully, there‚Äôll be more anecdotes to spill and meal to discuss and share.

title: 7 Attractions You Cannot Miss Out on Your Next Trip to Melbourne, Victoria - MissMalini
article_content: Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Melbourne, in Australia, is one of the hottest travel destinations right now. It has got everything you need to make your next vacation, a wholesome one. From outdoor activities to a variety of cultural experiences, it would not be wrong of me to say that there is something for everyone in Melbourne, Victoria. Looking for an itinerary of what to do when in and around Melbourne, don‚Äôt worry I‚Äôve got you covered. For cricket lovers to wine connoisseurs, here are 7 attractions you should definitely not miss out on, on your next trip there‚Ä¶ 1. Melbourne Cricket Ground If you are a cricket fan, this one should definitely be on your list. Also known as ‚ÄòThe G‚Äô , it holds a lot of cultural importance in the cricket world. Situated between the suburbs of East Melbourne and Richmond, this place is only a fifteen-minute walk away from the city. There are some iconic landmarks in the stadium that you as a cricket fan can cherish forever like the MCC Long Room, portrait of Sir Donald Bradman, MCC Library, a walk in the arena and the City Terrace with the best views of Melbourne‚Äôs skyline. But as an Indian, something that might make your heart skip a beat is the portrait of the legendary Sachin Tendulkar in the stadium. 2. Melbourne Zoo Australia is widely known for its wildlife and the Melbourne Zoo is a place people of all ages will definitely enjoy. A day at the zoo is a must on your itinerary when visiting Melbourne. The zoo has around 320 species, which includes unique Australian wildlife like Kangaroos, Koalas, and Orangutans. The underwater world at the zoo boasts of Victorian penguins and fur seals which will make for the perfect day for your kids. And that is not all, you can also stroll through the lush rainforests where tigers roam and monkeys are seen swinging. Not all of these species are something that you will find in India, so as an Indian tourist, this should definitely be on your itinerary. 3. Federation Square Located at the heart of the city, Fed Square boasts of a very happening and bustling life. From world-class art galleries to a diverse range of food, this is the place you should definitely hit with your friends and family on your next trip to Melbourne. Looking to hop into a club with your mates? Or wish to splurge on some retail therapy? Then this location is the perfect way to end your day or even spend your afternoons at by just sitting and relaxing or reading a book in the middle of Fed Square! 4. Twelve Apostles These magnificent rocks that arise from the Southern Ocean on Victoria‚Äôs coastline are an unmissable experience for every tourist. Just a four-hour drive from Melbourne, the best time to witness their splendid beauty is during sunset. You can also view the 12 Apostles in a helicopter ride if you wish to take this experience to another level. Now how can one say no to this? I surely cannot. 5. Grampians Here‚Äôs a National Park that is loaded with activities for you to take on. If you‚Äôre someone who is looking to chase waterfalls, this is the go-to place for you. As you hike through the Grampians National Park, you will be rewarded with some of the most majestic waterfalls and rock pools. As an Indian tourist, you will thoroughly enjoy these clean water bodies and I would highly recommend visiting the MacKenzie waterfall . Apart from this, you can also visit the wine region in the Grampians and sip at scenic views with your loved ones. 6. Wine Tours at Yarra Valley and Dandenong Ranges Looking for a relaxing day as you sip on your wine and eat some delicious cheese? We‚Äôve got the perfect go-to place for you. Visit Domaine Chandon for a premium sparkling wine tour, or stop at the Yarra Valley Dairy or the Yarra Valley Chocolaterie to nibble on some snacks. Sipping wine with a scenic landscape view, isn‚Äôt that everything a vacation should be about? 7. Geelong and the Bellarine Soak up the good life in the Geelong and Bellarine region by exploring Geelong‚Äôs waterfront precinct, and tranquil seaside villages, and meeting local makers and growers along the Bellarine Taste Trail. For a perfect summer afternoon, wander down historic streetscapes and tee off at lush golf courses. Indulge in the burgeoning foodie scene, complete with craft breweries, local wineries, farm gates and provedores. Enjoy the pleasant breeze and the ocean view while you surf, paddle and swim at the bay and beaches. There are more than these seven attractions that Melbourne and Regional Victoria have to offer to you, but I guess you will have to visit and explore the rest! So, when are you planning your next trip? All images are owned by Visit Victoria.

title: Juliette: A Gastronomic Journey Through European And Mediterranean Delights In Mumbai - MissMalini
article_content: Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Mumbai, a city celebrated for its vibrant culinary landscape, beckons food enthusiasts to indulge in the delectable offerings at Juliette Ristorante. Tucked away as a hidden culinary gem, this expansive 4000-square-foot European restaurant in the western suburbs has been enchanting patrons for over a year. Helmed by the esteemed Chef Ravraj Chandhok, the establishment guarantees a gastronomic journey filled with European and Mediterranean delights, promising a memorable dining experience. Upon stepping into Juliette Ristorante, guests are embraced by a spacious and stylish ambiance adorned with a captivating monochromatic theme. The indoor seating, complemented by an imposing tree installation adorned with twinkling fairy lights, creates a nature-inspired and idyllic atmosphere. Whether opting for the vibrant alfresco seating or the sheltered indoor division, the restaurant provides the perfect setting for a sumptuous meal. Juliette Ristorante‚Äôs breakfast menu caters to those in search of an elevated morning experience. The Tunisian Olive & Caper Eggs, a Mediterranean-inspired delight, offers a unique twist to baked eggs. Nestled in a bed of pomodoro fresca and adorned with olives and capers, this dish promises a burst of Tunisian goodness. For gluten-free enthusiasts, the option of toasted sourdough bread accompanies this creation. Complementing the culinary experience are Juliette‚Äôs captivating cocktails, such as the mesmerizing ‚ÄúFirst Date,‚Äù the entrancing ‚ÄúAmore Mio,‚Äù the passionate ‚ÄúTe Amo,‚Äù the contented ‚ÄúAfternoon Love,‚Äù or the iconic ‚ÄúJuliette‚Äôs Kiss,‚Äù elevating the overall dining experience. The gastronomic journey continues with delightful starters, including the classic Caesar Salad, the sophisticated Chimichurri Burrata, and the gluten-free and vegan-friendly Jardiniere salad. The soup selection boasts richness with options like Roasted Harissa Tomato & Holy Basil and Truffle Scented Wild Mushroom. The Brasied Beetroot Salad and Grilled Romaine & Shaved Fennel provide vibrant, flavorful choices, while the Quinoa Salad caters to gluten-free and vegan preferences. Juliette Ristorante‚Äôs commitment to authenticity shines through in their pizzas crafted with fine sourdough and pastas like Homemade Potato Gnocchi and Spinach & Mascarpone Ravioli. The Mascarpone Rose Risotto offers a delightful twist. Concluding the meal on a sweet note is the Hazelnut Torte with a dollop of ice cream or the irresistible Pull Me Up Tiramisu. The restaurant seamlessly blends chic aesthetics with traditional international dining standards, offering a classy haven for gourmet enthusiasts. Transforming effortlessly into a romantic retreat, Juliette becomes an ideal destination for enchanting date nights. The intimate ambiance, illuminated by the soft glow of fairy lights and the cozy indoor seating, sets the stage for an unforgettable evening. With its carefully curated menu featuring a diverse selection of European and Mediterranean delights, Juliette ensures a memorable experience for those seeking fine food and exquisite cocktails in the heart of Mumbai‚Äôs culinary landscape.

title: Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani Review - An Entertaining Love Story
article_content: Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! Hi Guest Join India's #1 source for updates! When Karan Johar sits on the director‚Äôs chair, there‚Äôs a reason why everyone‚Äôs expectations of experiencing cinema in an enhanced manner heightens. With Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani, I felt this by every bit and beyond. The stellar star cast, inclusive of Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Jaya Bachchan, Dharmendra, and Shabana Azmi manages to fill up the screen with their magic getting the audience to experience every emotion. The storyline stays true to the predictions made when the trailer was dropped, with a few elements of pleasant surprises. So, here is the Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani movie review. Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani revolves around the love story of Rocky Randhawa ( Ranveer Singh ) and Rani Chatterjee ( Alia Bhatt ), who belong to contrasting worlds but meet thanks to star-crossed lovers from within their family (no, I‚Äôm not giving spoilers!) from years ago. Amid the efforts of bringing the lovers from the past together, a new love blossoms and this marks the beginning of the drama within the households that unfold. Rocky and Rani decide to live in each other‚Äôs house for 3 months to get their families to know them better and help Rocky and Rani get a chance to win over the families too. Along the path, the stereotypical practises of patriarchy and classism within the households are met with realisations of how to get with the times and bring the much needed change. Karan Johar brings this love story to life with the perfect casting of Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt. Along with foundation of love, Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani generously has with some hilarious comic moments that‚Äôll get you laughing and emotional moments that‚Äôll get you teary-eyed. The songs with the magnanimous sets ensure that not only are your ears but also your eyes are treated to the grandeur. The snow clad Kashmir locales with the tunes of ‚ÄòTum Kya Mile‚Äô sure helped me feel the Yash Raj classic Bollywood romance. There were quite a few Bollywood references that were predicted in the trailer and as the songs dropped one by one. To all those who could feel the 2 States and Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham vibe in the snippets before the release, there‚Äôs a dash of that too for you! Jaya Bachchan saying, ‚ÄúKeh Diya Na, Bas Keh Diya‚Äù is what I‚Äôve longed to hear since years, and never imagined for it to come true, until today! Not to forget the wonderful performance of Ranveer Singh and Tota Roy Chowdhury on Dola Re Dola that Dhindhora Baje Re reminded everyone of. TBH, KJo played it smart by ensuring that the predictions being a part of the film would put the chitter chatter to rest in the best manner. So if you‚Äôre looking at experiencing Bollywood in the most stereotypical, entertaining, best way ever‚Ä¶ Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani is a must-watch.
